senses.sense_definition: The former name of the International Telecommunication Union - Telecommunication Standardization Sector (ITU-T), an organization that coordinates standards for telecommunications.

examples.text: Many older fax machines still operate based on protocols originally defined by the <w>CCITT</w>.
Although the organization was renamed in 1992, some engineers still refer to the <w>CCITT</w> standards in legacy documentation.
